sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between two heat reservoirs at temperatures of 400 K and 300 K. What is the maximum theoretical efficiency of the engine based on Carnot cycle?
message_2:
The maximum theoretical efficiency of a heat engine based on the Carnot cycle can be calculated using the following formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir (300 K) and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir (400 K).

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 400 K)
Efficiency = 1 - 0.75
Efficiency = 0.25

The maximum theoretical efficiency of the engine based on the Carnot cycle is 25%.
